member.name: M:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.AcquireImage
member.summary: Displays the source's built-in interface to acquire image.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: This method does the same thing as EnableSource(). The purpose of providing this method is to enable user to handle Twain-compliant image acquisition device without knowing the terms used in Twain specification. Please note webcam module is Not yet supported in DynamicDotNetTWAIN.Wpf.dll. In DynamicDotNetTWAIN.dll, both scanner module and webcam module are supported.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.CapGet
member.summary: Gets information of the capability specified by the Capability property.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks:
Before invoking CapGet(), Capability property should be set.
CapType property needs not to be set, since when CapGet() is called, The container type is returned by the source, rather than specified by the application.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.CapGetCurrent
member.summary: Returns the Source's current value for the specified capability.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: Before invoking CapGetCurrent(), Capability property should be set. After calling CapGetCurrent(), check CapType property for the capability container type and then read information from different properties according to the container type. This process is the same as CapGet(), please refer to CapType property and Reading Value(s) from Capability Negotiation.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.CapGetDefault
member.summary: Returns the Source's default value for the specified capability. This is the Source's preferred default value.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: Before invoking CapGetDefault(), Capability property should be set. The Source's Default Value cannot be changed. Using the Source's preferred default as the Current Value may increase performance in some Sources.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.CapGetFrameBottom(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the value (in ICAP_UNITS) of the bottom-most edge of the specified frame.
member.param: Specifies the value of which frame to get. The index is 0-based.
member.returns: The data type of the return value is Single (float).
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: The unit of CapGetFrameBottom() is determined by ICAP_UNITS capability. The default unit is assumed to be "inches" unless it has been otherwise negotiated between the application and source. CapGetFrameBottom() is different from ImageLayoutFrameBottom property. CapGetFrameBottom() is part of ICAP_FRAMES capability negotiation. It can return the value of any frames in a page. ImageLayoutFrameBottom property only returns the value of the current frame which is being transferred. It is valid only in OnPreTransfer and OnPostTransfer event.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.CapIfSupported(Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWQC)
member.summary: Queries whether the Source supports a particular operation on the capability.
member.param: TWQC type: specifies the type of capability operation. Value Description TWQC_GET (1): If CapGet() is supported by the capability. TWQC_SET (2): If CapSet() is supported by the capability. TWQC_GETDEFAULT (4): If CapGetDefault() is supported by the capability. TWQC_GETCURRENT (8): If CapGetCurrent() is supported by the capability. TWQC_RESET (16): If CapReset() is supported by the capability.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: The capability to query should be set in Capability property before calling CapIfSupported().

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.FeedPage
member.summary: Sets the Source to eject the current page and advance the next page in the document feeder into the feeder acquire area when IfFeederEnabled is true.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: Using this property after opening the Data Source (see OpenSource() method) and checking if the value of IfFeederEnabled property is true.

members.member:
Loads the specified Source into main memory and starts its initialization, placing Dynamic .NET TWAIN into Capability Negotiation state. If no source is specified (no SelectSource() or SelectSourceByIndex() is called), opens the default source. True indicates success. False indicates failure. When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
OpenSource() should be called prior to negotiating capability. If no source selection function is called before OpenSource(), OpenSource() opens the default source. The capability is available after OpenSource is called. Please note webcam module is Not yet supported in DynamicDotNetTWAIN.Wpf.dll. In DynamicDotNetTWAIN.dll, both scanner module and webcam module are supported.
modified by soul

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.OpenSourceManager
member.summary: Loads and opens Data Source Manager.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: If application identification information needs to be set, it should be set before OpenSourceManager(). Dynamic .NET TWAIN has built-in Wizard Mode. With Wizard Mode, OpenSourceManager() can be called intelligently by other functions, such as EnableSource() or SelectSource(), if necessary. OpenSourceManager() populates SourceNameItems property with a list of installed sources. SourceNameItems property along with other properties and methods can be used to customize source selection interface.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.SetFileXFERInfo(System.String,Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWICapFileFormat)
member.summary: Sets file name and file format information used in File Transfer Mode
member.param: The name of the file to be used in transfer.

TWICapFileFormat type: a enumerated values indicates the format of the image. The followings are the allowed formats: TWFF_TIFF(0), TWFF_PICT(1), TWFF_BMP(2), TWFF_XBM(3), TWFF_JFIF(4), TWFF_FPX(5), TWFF_TIFFMULTI(6), TWFF_PNG(7), TWFF_SPIFF(8), TWFF_EXIF( 9)
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: The SetFileXFERInfo() is valid only in File Transfer Mode. Before using any file format, negotiate ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT capability to make sure if the Source can handle the desired image format. In File Transfer Mode, the image is transferred to the designated file directly and there is no image in Dynamic .NET TWAIN.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.GetCapItems(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an array of values of the capability specified by Capability property, when the value of the CapType property is TWON_ARRAY or TWON_ENUMERATION. This is a runtime property.
member.param: The index is 0-based.
member.returns: Capability property value.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: Reading this property after calling CapGet() method. This property has a parameter. The data type of the parameter is int and it is 0-based. The GetCapItems is used to present Double, Single(Float), Long, Integer and even Boolean types. For String type, please use GetCapItemsString. When using Double type for Boolean type, 1 denotes true, 0 denotes false. The constant true/False of Visual Basic can NOT be used. This is very like CapValue property and CapValueString property, where CapValueString property is used to present String type and CapValue is used to present other types. CapValue property and CapValueString property are used when the container type is TWON_ONEVALUE.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.SetCapItems(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets an array of values of the capability specified by Capability property, when the value of the CapType property is TWON_ARRAY or TWON_ENUMERATION. This is a runtime property.
member.param: The index is 0-based.
Capability property value.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: After setting this property, call CapSet() method to actually set the value. The SetCapItems property is used to present Double, Single(Float), Long, Integer and even Boolean types. For String type, please use SetCapItemsString. When using Double type for Boolean type, 1 denotes true, 0 denotes false. The constant true/False of Visual Basic can NOT be used. This is very like CapValue property and CapValueString property, where CapValueString property is used to present String type and CapValue is used to present other types. CapValue property and CapValueString property are used when the container type is TWON_ONEVALUE.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.HTTPUploadThroughPost(System.String,System.Int16,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Uploads the image of a specified index in buffer to the HTTP server through HTTP POST method.
member.param: The name of the HTTP server.It should be only the name of the HTTP server, without "http://" or "https://".Port number is not needed here.
Specifies the index of image in buffer. The index is 0-based.
The specified page for posting image files. This is the relative path of the page, not the absolute path. For example: "upload.asp", not "http://www.webserver.com/upload.asp".
The name of the image to be uploaded.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: Dynamic .NET TWAIN processes the image format according to the extension of the FileName. Dynamic .NET TWAIN supports the following types of image files: Bitmap *.bmp, *.dib JPEG *.JPG, *.JPEG, .*.JPE, *.JFIF TIFF *.TIF, *.TIFF PNG *.PNG PDF *.PDF The field name of the uploaded image is RemoteFile. IMPORTANT: Dynamic .NET TWAIN uses a special way to see if an image is uploaded and processed successfully by server. If the server returns 0 bytes, indicates success. Otherwise, indicates failure. In other words, when the uploaded image is processed successfully, the action page on the server should not return anything, even the "HTML". When the uploaded file is in TIFF format, if the value of IfTiffMultiPage is true, and there's a TIFF file with the same name on the server, the newly uploaded images will be added into the existing file. If the value of IfTiffMultiPage is false, the old file will be replaced. If the uploaded file is in another format, and there's a file with the same name on the server, the newly uploaded file will replace the old one.

member.remarks: Dynamic .NET TWAIN processes the image format according to the extension of the HTTPRemoteFile. Dynamic .NET TWAIN supports the following types of image files: Bitmap *.bmp, *.dib JPEG *.JPG, *.JPEG, .*.JPE, *.JFIF TIFF *.TIF, *.TIFF PNG *.PNG PDF *.PDF StrHTTPRemoteFile parameter should include the HTTP directory of the file. Write permission of the specified directory is needed for uploading. When the uploaded file is in TIFF format, if the value of IfTiffMultiPage is true, and there's a TIFF file with the same name on the server, the newly uploaded images will be added into the existing file. If the value of IfTiffMultiPage is false, the old file will be replaced. If the uploaded file is in another format, and there's a file with the same name on the server, the newly uploaded file will replace the old one.

But if aryIndex contains repeated valid index, the repeated index will be filtered, only keep one index. After the selected image is deleted, the following images's indices will change accordingly. If the original CurrentImageIndexInBuffer >= HowManyImagesInBuffer, CurrentImageIndexInBuffer = HowManyImagesInBuffer; Also the image will be selected. If the original CurrentImageIndexInBuffer is less than HowManyImagesInBuffer, CurrentImageIndexInBuffer will not change; also the image with index of CurrentImageIndexInBuffer will be selected.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.CapCurrentIndex
member.summary: Returns or sets the index (0-based) of a list to indicate the Current Value when the value of the CapType property is TWON_ENUMERATION. If the data type of the capability is String, the list is in GetCapItemsString. For other data types, the list is in GetCapItems. This is a runtime property.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: Reading this property after calling CapGet() method. After setting this property, call CapSet() method to actually set the value. The CapCurrentIndex property is 0-based. It is valid only when the CapType property is TWON_ENUMERATION. For information of which properties are valid for different container types, please refer to CapType property.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.CapType
member.summary: Returns or sets the type of capability container used to exchange capability information between application and source. This is a runtime property.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks:
Allowed ValuesDescription
TWON_ARRAY(3) An array of associated individual values. CapNumItems property, GetCapItems/SetCapItems/GetCapItemsString/SetCapItemsString are valid.
TWON_ENUMERATION(4)A group of associated individual values. The values are ordered from the lowest to highest values, but the step size between every two values is probably not uniform. CapNumItems property, CapCurrentIndex property, CapDefaultIndex property, GetCapItems/SetCapItems/GetCapItemsString/SetCapItemsString are valid.
TWON_ONEVALUE(5)A single value. CapValue property or CapValueString property is valid.
TWON_RANGE(6)A range of individual values. CapMinValue property, CapMaxValue property, CapStepSize property, CapDefaultValue property and CapCurrentValue property are valid.
CapType property does not need to be set before CapGet() is called. CapDefaultIndex property and CapDefaultValue property reflect power-on values and are not available with CapSet().

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.CapValueType
member.summary: Returns or sets the value type for reading the value of a capability. This is a runtime property.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: Reading this property after calling CapGet() method. After setting this property, call CapSet() method to actually set the value.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.CapValue
member.summary: Returns or sets the value of the capability specified by Capability property when the value of the CapType property is TWON_ONEVALUE. This is a runtime property.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: Reading this property after calling CapGet() method. After setting this property, call CapSet() method to actually set the value. The Double type of CapValue property is used to present Double, Single(Float), Long, Integer and even Boolean types. For String type, please use CapValueString property. When using Double type for Boolean type, 1 denotes true, 0 denotes false. The constant true/False of Visual Basic can NOT be used. This is very like GetCapItems and GetCapItemsString, where GetCapItemsString is used to present String type and GetCapItems is used to present other types. GetCapItems and GetCapItemsString are used when the container type is TWON_ARRAY or TWON_ENUMERATION.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.CapValueString
member.summary: Returns or sets the string value for a capability when the value of the CapType property is TWON_ONEVALUE. This is a runtime property.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: Reading this property after calling CapGet() method. After setting this property, call CapSet() method to actually set the value. CapValueString property is used to set or return String type value. For any other data types when the CapType property is TWON_ONEVALUE, use CapValue property.

member.summary: Returns or sets whether close the Data Source User Interface after acquire all images. Default value of this property is false.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: IfShowUI IfDisableSourceAfterAcquire Actions true false UI will be shown, user can acquire many images, user must close UI himself true true UI will be shown, only one image will be acquired, UI will be closed automatically false false UI will not be shown, one or many images will be acquired (if the source supports), the device will not be closed automatically and needs to be closed by DisableSource() method false true UI will not be shown, one or many images will be acquired (if the source supports), the device will be closed automatically

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.IfDuplexEnabled

member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: Call OpenSource() method and confirm that the duplex is supported before using this property.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.IfFeederEnabled
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the Automatic Document Feeder (ADF) is enabled. This is a runtime property.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: If the value of this property is true, Source must acquire data from the document feeder acquire area and other feeder capabilities can be used. If the value of this property is false, Source must acquire data from the non-feeder acquire area and no other feeder capabilities can be used. Call OpenSource() method before using this property.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.ImageLayoutFrameBottom
member.summary: Returns the value of the bottom-most edge of the current image frame (in ICAP_UNITS). This is a read-only runtime property.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: The unit of ImageLayoutFrameBottom property is determined by ICAP_UNITS capability. The default unit is assumed to be "inches" unless it has been otherwise negotiated between the application and source. ImageLayoutFrameBottom property, along with other properties about information of the current image, is valid only in OnPreTransfer and OnPostTransfer event. The frame information here is only about the current frame. To get the information about all the frames to be transferred in an acquire session, please use capability negotiation. The capability to be negotiated is ICAP_FRAMES. Please refer to How to negotiate ICAP_FRAMES for details and sample code.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.ImageLayoutFrameLeft

ImageLayoutFrameLeft property, along with other properties about information of the current image, is valid only in OnPreTransfer and OnPostTransfer event. The frame information here is only about the current frame. To get the information about all the frames to be transferred in an acquire session, please use capability negotiation. The capability to be negotiated is ICAP_FRAMES. Please refer to How to negotiate ICAP_FRAMES for details and sample code.

ImageLayoutFrameNumber property, along with other properties about information of the current image, is valid only in OnPreTransfer and OnPostTransfer event. member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.ImageLayoutFrameTop
member.summary: Returns the value of the top-most edge of the current image frame (in ICAP_UNITS). This is a runtime, read-only property.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: The unit of ImageLayoutFrameTop property is determined by ICAP_UNITS capability. The default unit is assumed to be "inches" unless it has been otherwise negotiated between the application and source. ImageLayoutFrameTop property, along with other properties about information of the current image, is valid only in OnPreTransfer and OnPostTransfer event. The frame information here is only about the current frame. To get the information about all the frames to be transferred in an acquire session, please use capability negotiation. The capability to be negotiated is ICAP_FRAMES. Please refer to How to negotiate ICAP_FRAMES for details and sample code.

member.summary: Returns or sets the border style.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks:
Allowed ValuesDescription
None (0)No border

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.CurrentImageIndexInBuffer
member.summary: Returns or sets current index of image in buffer. This is a runtime property.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: The index is 0 based. Current image is alwarys selected. By changing CurrentImageIndexInBuffer, you can enumerate all the images in buffer. When CurrentImageIndexInBuffer is changed, the control will be redrawn to reflect the change. When an image is added to buffer, the CurrentImageIndexInBuffer is skipped to the next one and the new image is added there. When image buffer is full, that is HowManyImagesInBuffer = MaxImagesInBuffer, the new acquired or loaded image will replace the existing one, positioned by CurrentImageIndexInBuffer. For example, if HowManyImagesInBuffer = 4 and MaxImagesInBuffer = 4, CurrentImageIndexInBuffer = 3, after a new image is acquired, the CurrentImageIndexInBuffer is set to 0, and the 1st image is replaced by the new acquired one . If another image is acquired again, the CurrentImageIndexInBuffer is set to 1 and the 2nd image is replaced by the new acquired one. If an image is selected, the value of CurrentImageIndexInBuffer will be the index of the selected image.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.EnableInteractiveZoom

member.remarks: If it is set to true. The user can use hot key "Ctrl + Mouse Wheel" or "Alt + Mouse Wheel" to zoom in/out the image, use "+" (small keyboard) to zoom in the image, and use "-" (small keyboard) to zoom out the image. The default value of this property is true.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.Zoom
member.summary: Returns or sets zoom factor for the image, only valid When the view mode is set to -1 by -1. This is a runtime property.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: The zoom value is expressed as a percentage. The valid range is from 2 to 6500 percent (Value: 0.02 ~ 65.0); the default value is 100 percent (Value: 1.0). A zoom value can be specified before or after an image is displayed. When the zoom value is changed, the displayed image will refresh automatically.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.SelectionImageBorderColor
member.summary: Returns or sets the border color of the selected image. It is a value specifying the 32-bit ARGB value.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: Default is Navy. The byte-ordering of the 32-bit ARGB value is AARRGGBB. The most significant byte (MSB), represented by AA, is the alpha component value. The second, third, and fourth bytes, represented by RR, GG, and BB, are the color components red, green, and blue respectively.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.IfShowPrintUI
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the driver of the printer displays the User Interface.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is false, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is true, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks: If the property is false(default), the driver of the printer will display its User Interface when invoking the Print method. If the property is false, the User Interface will not be displayed and the print process will get started immediately.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.DynamicDotNetTwain.AnnotationType
member.summary: Returns or sets the annotation type. To use the property,the property MouseShape should be set to false.
member.exception: When an error occurs and IfThrowException property is true, an exception will be thrown. When IfThrowException property is false, please check ErrorCode and ErrorString.
member.remarks:
Allowed ValuesAnnotation Types
enumNone(default)Select an area
enumPointer(Pointer)Select an existing annotation. Press "Ctrl" to multi-select annotations.
enumText(Text)Create a text.The annotation type will be set back to 1 once the annotation is completed..
enumLine(Line)Create a line.The annotation type will be set back to 1 once the annotation is completed..
enumRectangle(Rectangle)Create a rectangle.The annotation type will be set back to 1 once the annotation is completed..
enumEllipse(Ellipse)Create a ellipse.The annotation type will be set back to 1 once the annotation is completed..
Please note this method/property is Not yet supported in DynamicDotNetTWAIN.Wpf.dll. But it is available in DynamicDotNetTWAIN.dll.

member.name: T:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapType
member.summary: Capabilities exist in many varieties but all have a Default Value, Current Value, and may have other values available that can be supported if selected. To help categorize the supported values into clear structures, TWAIN defines four types of containers for capabilities: TW_ONEVALUE, TW_ARRAY, TW_RANGE and TW_ENUMERATION.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapType.TWON_NONE
member.summary: Nothing.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapType.TWON_ARRAY
member.summary: A rectangular array of values that describe a logical item. It is similar to the TW_ONEVALUE because the current and default values are the same and there are no other values to select from. For example, a list of the names, such as the supported capabilities list returned by the CAP_SUPPORTEDCAPS capability, would use this type of container.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapType.TWON_ENUMERATION
member.summary: This is the most general type because it defines a list of values from which the Current Value can be chosen. The values do not progress uniformly through a range and there is not a consistent step size between the values. For example, if a Source's resolution options do not occur in even step sizes then an enumeration would be used (for example, 150, 400, and 600).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapType.TWON_ONEVALUE
member.summary: A single value whose current and default values are coincident. The range of available values for this type of capability is simply this single value. For example, a capability that indicates the presence of a document feeder could be of this type.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapType.TWON_RANGE
member.summary: Many capabilities allow users to select their current value from a range of regularly spaced values. The capability can specify the minimum and maximum acceptable values and the incremental step size between the values. For example, resolution might be supported from 100 to 600 in steps of 50 (100, 150, 200, ..., 550, 600).

member.name: T:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability
member.summary: Capabilities.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_NONE
member.summary: Nothing.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_XFERCOUNT
member.summary: The application is willing to accept this number of images.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_COMPRESSION
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which compression schemes they have in common for Buffered Memory and File transfers. Note for File transfers: Since only certain file formats support compression, this capability must be negotiated after setting the desired file format with ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PIXELTYPE
member.summary: The type of pixel data that a Source is capable of acquiring (for example, black and white, gray, RGB, etc.).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_UNITS
member.summary: Unless a quantity is dimensionless or uses a specified unit of measure, ICAP_UNITS determines the unit of measure for all quantities.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_XFERMECH
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which transfer mechanisms the source supports.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_AUTHOR
member.summary: The name or other identifying information about the Author of the image. It may include a copyright string.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_CAPTION
member.summary: A general note about the acquired image.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_FEEDERENABLED
member.summary: If TRUE, Source must acquire data from the document feeder acquire area and other feeder capabilities can be used. If FALSE, Source must acquire data from the non-feeder acquire area and no other feeder capabilities can be used.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_FEEDERLOADED
member.summary: Reflect whether there are documents loaded in the Source’s feeder.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_TIMEDATE
member.summary:
The date and time the image was acquired.
Stored in the form “YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm:SS.sss” where YYYY is the year, MM is the numerical month, DD is the numerical day, HH is the hour, mm is the minute, SS is the second, and sss is the millisecond.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_SUPPORTEDCAPS
member.summary: Returns a list of all the capabilities for which the Source will answer inquiries. Does not indicate which capabilities the Source will allow to be set by the application. Some capabilities can only be set if certain setup work has been done so the Source cannot globally answer which capabilities are “set-able.”

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_EXTENDEDCAPS
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to negotiate capabilities to be used in States 5 and 6.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_AUTOFEED
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will automatically feed the next page from the document feeder after the number of frames negotiated for capture from each page are acquired. CAP_FEEDERENABLED must be TRUE to use this capability.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_CLEARPAGE
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will eject the current page being acquired from and will leave the feeder acquire area empty. If CAP_AUTOFEED is TRUE, a fresh page will be advanced. CAP_FEEDERENABLED must equal TRUE to use this capability. This capability must have been negotiated as an extended capability to be used in States 5 and 6.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_FEEDPAGE
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will eject the current page and advance the next page in the document feeder into the feeder acquire area. If CAP_AUTOFEED is TRUE, the same action just described will occur and CAP_AUTOFEED will remain active. CAP_FEEDERENABLED must equal TRUE to use this capability. This capability must have been negotiated as an extended capability to be used in States 5 and 6.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_REWINDPAGE
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will return the current page to the input side of the document feeder and feed the last page from the output side of the feeder back into the acquisition area. If CAP_AUTOFEED is TRUE, automatic feeding will continue after all negotiated frames from this page are acquired. CAP_FEEDERENABLED must equal TRUE to use this capability. This capability must have been negotiated as an extended capability to be used in States 5 and 6.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_INDICATORS
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will display a progress indicator during acquisition and transfer, regardless of whether the Source’s user interface is active. If FALSE, the progress indicator will be suppressed if the Source’s user interface is inactive. The Source will continue to display device-specific instructions and error messages even with the Source user interface and progress indicators turned off.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_SUPPORTEDCAPSEXT
member.summary: Returns a list of all the capabilities for which the Source will answer inquiries. Does not indicate which capabilities the Source will allow to be set by the application. Some capabilities can only be set if certain setup work has been done so the Source cannot globally answer which capabilities are “set-able.”

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_PAPERDETECTABLE
member.summary: This capability determines whether the device has a paper sensor that can detect documents on the ADF or Flatbed.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_UICONTROLLABLE
member.summary: If TRUE, indicates that this Source supports acquisition with the UI disabled; i.e., TW_USERINTERFACE’s ShowUI field can be set to FALSE. If FALSE, indicates that this Source can only support acquisition with the UI enabled.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_DEVICEONLINE
member.summary: If TRUE, the physical hardware (e.g., scanner, digital camera, image database, etc.) that represents the image source is attached, powered on, and communicating.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_AUTOSCAN
member.summary: This capability is intended to boost the performance of a Source. The fundamental assumption behind AutoScan is that the device is able to capture the number of images indicated by the value of CAP_XFERCOUNT without waiting for the Application to request the image transfers. This is only possible if the device has internal buffers capable of caching the images it captures. The default behavior is undefined, because some high volume devices are incapable of anything but CAP_AUTOSCAN being equal to TRUE. However, if a Source supports FALSE, it should use it as the mandatory default, since this best describes the behavior of pre-1.8 TWAIN Applications.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_THUMBNAILSENABLED
member.summary: Allows an application to request the delivery of thumbnail representations for the set of images that are to be delivered. Setting CAP_THUMBNAILSENABLED to TRUE turns on thumbnail mode. Images transferred thereafter will be sent at thumbnail size (exact thumbnail size is determined by the Data Source). Setting this capability to FALSE turns thumbnail mode off and returns full size images.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_DUPLEX
member.summary: This indicates whether the scanner supports duplex. If so, it further indicates whether one-path or two-path duplex is supported.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_DUPLEXENABLED
member.summary: The user can set the duplex option to be TRUE or FALSE. If TRUE, the scanner scans both sides of a paper; otherwise, the scanner will scan only one side of the image.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_ENABLEDSUIONLY
member.summary: Allows an application to query a source to see if it implements the new user interface settings dialog.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_ENDORSER
member.summary: Allows the application to specify the starting endorser / imprinter number. All other endorser/ imprinter properties should be handled through the data source’s user interface. The user can set the starting number for the endorser.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_ALARMS
member.summary: Turns specific audible alarms on and off.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_ALARMVOLUME
member.summary: The volume of a device’s audible alarm. Note that this control affects the volume of all alarms; no specific volume control for individual types of alarms is provided.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_AUTOMATICCAPTURE
member.summary: The number of images to automatically capture. This does not refer to the number of images to be sent to the Application, use CAP_XFERCOUNT for that.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_TIMEBEFOREFIRSTCAPTURE
member.summary: For automatic capture, this value selects the number of milliseconds before the first picture is to be taken, or the first image is to be scanned.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_TIMEBETWEENCAPTURES
member.summary: For automatic capture, this value selects the milliseconds to wait between pictures taken, or images scanned.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_CLEARBUFFERS
member.summary: CapGet() reports the presence of data in the scanner's buffers. CapSet() with a value of TWCB_CLEAR immediately clears the buffers.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_MAXBATCHBUFFERS
member.summary: Describes the number of pages that the scanner can buffer when CAP_AUTOSCAN is enabled.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_DEVICETIMEDATE
member.summary: The date and time of the device’s clock. Managed in the form “YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm:SS:sss” where YYYY is the year, MM is the numerical month, DD is the numerical day, HH is the hour, mm is the minute, SS is the second, and sss is the millisecond.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_POWERSUPPLY
member.summary: CapGet() reports the kinds of power available to the device. CapGetCurrent() reports the current power supply in use.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_CAMERAPREVIEWUI
member.summary: This capability queries the Source for UI support for preview mode. If TRUE, the Source supports preview UI.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_SERIALNUMBER
member.summary: A string containing the serial number of the currently selected device in the Source. Multiple devices may all report the same serial number.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_PRINTER
member.summary: CapGet() returns the current list of available printer devices, along with the one currently being used for negotiation. CapSet() selects the current device for negotiation, and optionally constrains the list. Top/Bottom refers to duplex devices, and indicates if the printer is writing on the top or the bottom of the sheet of paper. Simplex devices use the top settings. Before/After indicates whether printing occurs before or after the sheet of paper has been scanned.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_PRINTERENABLED
member.summary: Turns the current CAP_PRINTER device on or off.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_PRINTERINDEX
member.summary: The User can set the starting number for the current CAP_PRINTER device.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_PRINTERMODE
member.summary: Specifies the appropriate current CAP_PRINTER device mode. Note: • TWPM_SINGLESTRING specifies that the printed text will consist of a single string. • TWPM _MULTISTRING specifies that the printed text will consist of an enumerated list of strings to be printed in order. • TWPM _COMPOUNDSTRING specifies that the printed string will consist of a compound of a String followed by a value followed by a suffix string.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_PRINTERSTRING
member.summary: Specifies the string(s) that are to be used in the string component when the current CAP_PRINTER device is enabled.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_PRINTERSUFFIX
member.summary: Specifies the string that shall be used as the current CAP_PRINTER device’s suffix.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_LANGUAGE
member.summary: Allows Application and Source to identify which languages they have in common for the exchange of string data, and to select the language of the internal UI. Since the TWLG_xxxx codes include language and country data, there is no separate capability for selecting the country.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_FEEDERALIGNMENT
member.summary: Helps the Application determine any special actions it may need to take when negotiating frames with the Source. Allowed values are listed in . TWFA_NONE: The alignment is free-floating. Applications should assume that the origin for frames is on the left. TWFA_LEFT: The alignment is to the left. TWFA_CENTER: The alignment is centered. This means that the paper will be fed in the middle of the ICAP_PHYSICALWIDTH of the device. If this is set, then the Application should calculate any frames with a left offset of zero. TWFA_RIGHT: The alignment is to the right.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_FEEDERORDER
member.summary: TWFO_FIRSTPAGEFIRST if the feeder starts with the top of the first page. TWFO_LASTPAGEFIRST is the feeder starts with the top of the last page.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_REACQUIREALLOWED
member.summary: Indicates whether the physical hardware (e.g. scanner, digital camera) is capable of acquiring multiple images of the same page without changes to the physical registration of that page.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_BATTERYMINUTES
member.summary: The minutes of battery power remaining to the device.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_BATTERYPERCENTAGE
member.summary: When used with CapGet(), return the percentage of battery power level on camera. If -1 is returned, it indicates that the battery is not present.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_AUTOBRIGHT
member.summary: TRUE enables and FALSE disables the Source’s Auto-brightness function (if any).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BRIGHTNESS
member.summary: The brightness values available within the Source.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_CONTRAST
member.summary: The contrast values available within the Source.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_CUSTHALFTONE
member.summary: Specifies the square-cell halftone (dithering) matrix the Source should use to halftone the image.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_EXPOSURETIME
member.summary: Specifies the exposure time used to capture the image, in seconds.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_FILTER
member.summary: Describes the color characteristic of the subtractive filter applied to the image data. Multiple filters may be applied to a single acquisition.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_FLASHUSED
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the image was acquired using a flash.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_GAMMA
member.summary: Gamma correction value for the image data.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_HALFTONES
member.summary: A list of names of the halftone patterns available within the Source.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_HIGHLIGHT
member.summary: Specifies which value in an image should be interpreted as the lightest “highlight.” All values “lighter” than this value will be clipped to this value. Whether lighter values are smaller or larger can be determined by examining the Current value of ICAP_PIXELFLAVOR.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT
member.summary: Informs the application which file formats the Source can generate (CapGet()). Tells the Source which file formats the application can handle (CapSet()). TWFF_TIFF Used for document TWFF_PICT Native Macintosh TWFF_BMP Native Microsoft TWFF_XBM Used for document TWFF_JFIF Wrapper for JPEG TWFF_FPX FlashPix, used with digital TWFF_TIFFMULTI Multi-page TIFF files TWFF_PNG An image format standard intended for use on the web, replaces GIF TWFF_SPIFF A standard from JPEG, intended to replace JFIF, also supports JBIG TWFF_EXIF File format for use with digital cameras.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_LAMPSTATE
member.summary: TRUE means the lamp is currently, or should be set to ON. Sources may not support CapSet() operations.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_LIGHTSOURCE
member.summary: Describes the general color characteristic of the light source used to acquire the image.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_ORIENTATION
member.summary: Defines which edge of the "paper" the image's "top" is aligned with. This information is used to adjust the frames to match the scanning orientation of the paper. For instance, if an ICAP_SUPPORTEDSIZE of TWSS_ISOA4 has been negotiated, and ICAP_ORIENTATION is set to TWOR_LANDSCAPE, then the Source must rotate the frame it downloads to the scanner to reflect the orientation of the paper. Please note that setting ICAP_ORIENTATION does not affect the values reported by ICAP_FRAMES; it just causes the Source to use them in a different way. The upper-left of the image is defined as the location where both the primary and secondary scans originate. (The X axis is the primary scan direction and the Y axis is the secondary scan direction.) For a flatbed scanner, the light bar moves in the secondary scan direction. For a handheld scanner, the scanner is drug in the secondary scan direction. For a digital camera, the secondary direction is the vertical axis when the viewed image is considered upright.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PHYSICALWIDTH
member.summary: The maximum physical width (X-axis) the Source can acquire (measured in units of ICAP_UNITS).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PHYSICALHEIGHT
member.summary: The maximum physical height (Y-axis) the Source can acquire (measured in units of ICAP_UNITS).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_SHADOW
member.summary: Specifies which value in an image should be interpreted as the darkest “shadow.” All values “darker” than this value will be clipped to this value.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_FRAMES
member.summary: The list of frames the Source will acquire on each page.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_XNATIVERESOLUTION
member.summary: The native optical resolution along the X-axis of the device being controlled by the Source. Most devices will respond with a single value (TW_ONEVALUE). This is NOT a list of all resolutions that can be generated by the device. Rather, this is the resolution of the device’s optics. Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by ICAP_UNITS (pixels per TWUN_PIXELS yields dimensionless data).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_YNATIVERESOLUTION
member.summary: The native optical resolution along the Y-axis of the device being controlled by the Source. Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by ICAP_UNITS (pixels per TWUN_PIXELS yields dimensionless data).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_XRESOLUTION
member.summary: All the X-axis resolutions the Source can provide. Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by ICAP_UNITS (pixels per TWUN_PIXELS yields dimensionless data). That is, when the units are TWUN_PIXELS, both ICAP_XRESOLUTION and ICAP_YRESOLUTION shall report 1 pixel/pixel. Some data sources like to report the actual number of pixels that the device reports, but that response is more appropriate in ICAP_PHYSICALHEIGHT and ICAP_PHYSICALWIDTH.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_YRESOLUTION
member.summary: All the Y-axis resolutions the Source can provide. Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by ICAP_UNITS (pixels per TWUN_PIXELS yields dimensionless data). That is, when the units are TWUN_PIXELS, both ICAP_XRESOLUTION and ICAP_YRESOLUTION shall report 1 pixel/pixel. Some data sources like to report the actual number of pixels that the device reports, but that response is more appropriate in ICAP_PHYSICALHEIGHT and ICAP_PHYSICALWIDTH.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_MAXFRAMES
member.summary: The maximum number of frames the Source can provide or the application can accept per page. This is a bounding capability only. It does not establish current or future behavior.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_TILES
member.summary: This is used with buffered memory transfers. If TRUE, Source can provide application with tiled image data.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BITORDER
member.summary: Specifies how the bytes in an image are filled by the Source. TWBO_MSBFIRST indicates that the leftmost bit in the byte (usually bit 7) is the byte's Most Significant Bit.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_CCITTKFACTOR
member.summary: Used for CCITT Group 3 2-dimensional compression. The ‘K’ factor indicates how often the new compression baseline should be re-established. A value of 2 or 4 is common in facsimile communication. A value of zero in this field will indicate an infinite K factor—the baseline is only calculated at the beginning of the transfer.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_LIGHTPATH
member.summary: Describes whether the image was captured transmissively or reflectively.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PIXELFLAVOR
member.summary: Sense of the pixel whose numeric value is zero (minimum data value).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PLANARCHUNKY
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which color data formats are available. There are two options, “planar” and “chunky.”

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_ROTATION
member.summary: How the Source can/should rotate the scanned image data prior to transfer. This doesn’t use ICAP_UNITS. It is always measured in degrees. Any applied value is additive with any rotation specified in ICAP_ORIENTATION.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_SUPPORTEDSIZES
member.summary: For devices that support fixed frame sizes. Defined sizes match typical page sizes. This specifies the size(s) the Source can/should use to acquire image data.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_THRESHOLD
member.summary: Specifies the dividing line between black and white. This is the value the Source will use to threshold, if needed, when ICAP_PIXELTYPE = TWPT_BW. The value is normalized so there are no units of measure associated with this ICAP.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_XSCALING
member.summary: All the X-axis scaling values available. A value of ‘1.0’ is equivalent to 100% scaling. Do not use values less than or equal to zero.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_YSCALING
member.summary: All the Y-axis scaling values available. A value of ‘1.0’ is equivalent to 100% scaling. Do not use values less than or equal to zero. There are no units inherent with this data as it is normalized to 1.0 being “unscaled.”

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BITORDERCODES
member.summary: Used for CCITT data compression only. Indicates the bit order representation of the stored compressed codes.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PIXELFLAVORCODES
member.summary: Used only for CCITT data compression. Specifies whether the compressed codes’ pixel “sense” will be inverted from the Current value of ICAP_PIXELFLAVOR prior to transfer.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_JPEGPIXELTYPE
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to agree upon a common set of color descriptors that are made available by the Source. This ICAP is only useful for JPEG-compressed buffered memory image transfers.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_TIMEFILL
member.summary: Used only with CCITT data compression. Specifies the minimum number of words of compressed codes (compressed data) to be transmitted per line.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BITDEPTH
member.summary: Specifies the pixel bit depths for the Current value of ICAP_PIXELTYPE. For example, when using ICAP_PIXELTYPE = TWPT_GRAY, this capability specifies whether this is 8-bit gray or 4-bit gray. This depth applies to all the data channels (for instance, the R, G, and B channels will all have this same bit depth for RGB data).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BITDEPTHREDUCTION
member.summary: Specifies the Reduction Method the Source should use to reduce the bit depth of the data. Most commonly used with ICAP_PIXELTYPE = TWPT_BW to reduce gray data to black and white.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_UNDEFINEDIMAGESIZE
member.summary: If TRUE the Source will issue a MSG_XFERREADY before starting the scan. Note: The Source may need to scan the image before initiating the transfer. This is the case if the scanned image is rotated or merged with another scanned image.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_EXTIMAGEINFO
member.summary: Allows the application to query the data source to see if it supports extended image attribute capabilities, such as Barcode Recognition, Shaded Area Detection and Removal, Skew detection and Removal, and so on.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_MINIMUMHEIGHT
member.summary: Allows the source to define the minimum height (Y-axis) that the source can acquire.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_MINIMUMWIDTH
member.summary: Allows the source to define theminimum width (X-axis) that the source can acquire.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_AUTODISCARDBLANKPAGES
member.summary: Use this capability to have the Source discard blank images. The Application never sees these images during the scanning session. TWBP_DISABLE – this must be the default state for the Source. It indicates that all images will be delivered to the Application, none of them will be discarded. TWBP_AUTO – if this is used, then the Source will decide if an image is blank or not and discard as appropriate. If the specified value is a positive number in the range 0 to 231–1, then this capability will use it as the byte size cutoff point to identify which images are to be discarded. If the size of the image is less than or equal to this value, then it will be discarded. If the size of the image is greater than this value, then it will be kept so that it can be transferred to the Application.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_FLIPROTATION
member.summary: Flip rotation is used to properly orient images that flip orientation every other image. TWFR_BOOK The images to be scanned are viewed in book form, flipping each page from left to right or right to left. TWFR_FANFOLD The images to be scanned are viewed in fanfold paper style, flipping each page up or down.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_FLASHUSED2
member.summary: For devices that support flash. CapSet() selects the flash to be used (if any). CapGet() reports the current setting. This capability replaces ICAP_FLASHUSED, which is only able to negotiate the flash being on or off.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_IMAGEFILTER
member.summary: For devices that support image enhancement filtering. This capability selects the algorithm used to improve the quality of the image.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_NOISEFILTER
member.summary: For devices that support noise filtering. This capability selects the algorithm used to remove noise.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_OVERSCAN
member.summary: Overscan is used to scan outside of the boundaries described by ICAP_FRAMES, and is used to help acquire image data that may be lost because of skewing. This is primarily of use for transport scanners which rely on edge detection to begin scanning. If overscan is supported, then the device is capable of scanning in the inter-document gap to get the skewed image information.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Enums.TWEIBarcode.TWEI_BARCODECONFIDENCE
member.summary: This number reflects the degree of certainty the bar code engine has in the accuracy of the information obtained from the scanned image and ranges from 0 (no confidence) to 100 (supreme confidence). The Source may return a value of -1 if it does not support confidence reporting. members.member:
Occurs when each image is scanned.
This is the place to check property.
This is the place to read the properties of image information: property, property, property, property, property, property, property, property, property, property, property, property, property.
This is also the place to call . Event, Event, Event, Event, Event.

member.name: T:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Delegate.OnPreTransferHandler
member.summary: Occurs before each image is scanned.
member.remarks:
This is the place to read the properties of image information: ImageBitsPerPixel property, ImagePixelType property, ImageLength property, ImageWidth property, ImageXResolution property, ImageYResolution property, ImageLayoutDocumentNumber property, ImageLayoutFrameLeft property, ImageLayoutFrameTop property, ImageLayoutFrameRight property, ImageLayoutFrameBottom property, ImageLayoutPageNumber property, ImageLayoutFrameNumber property.
This is also the place to call CancelAllPendingTransfers().

member.name: T:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Delegate.OnPreAllTransfersHandler
member.summary: Occurs before all images are scanned.
member.remarks: Multiple transfers may occur when ADF(Auto Document Feeder) is enabled or there are more than one frames in a page. In those cases, more than one OnPreTransfer Event will be fired, and only one OnPreAllTransfers Event will be fired. This is the place to call CancelAllPendingTransfers().

member.name: T:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Delegate.OnPostAllTransfersHandler
member.summary: Occurs after all image are scanned.
member.remarks: Multiple transfers may occur when ADF(Auto Document Feeder) is enabled or there are more than one frames in a page. In those cases, more than one OnPostTransfer Event will be fired, and only one OnPostAllTransfers Event will be fired.

member.name: T:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Delegate.OnTransferErrorHandler
member.summary: Occurs when an error occurs during the process of transfer.

member.name: T:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Delegate.OnTransferCancelledHandler
member.summary: Occurs when the transfer is cancelled by the user.

member.name: T:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Delegate.OnMouseClickHandler
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse clicks on an image.
member.param: Specifies the index of image in buffer. The index is 0-based.
member.remarks: Short sImageIndex >=0. When the value of sImageIndex equals -1, it indicates that no image is clicked.

member.name: T:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Delegate.OnMouseMoveHandler
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse moves onto an image.
member.param: Specifies the index of image in buffer. The index is 0-based.
member.remarks: Short sImageIndex >=0. When the value of sImageIndex equals -1, it indicates that mouse is not on any image.

member.name: T:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Delegate.OnInternetTransferPercentageHandler
member.summary: Occurs when uploading or downloading images via HTTP or FTP.
member.param: Specifies upload or download progress.
Specifies if canncel upload or download. If you want to cancel upload or download, please set its member Cancelled value as true.
member.remarks: This event is triggered when user uploads or downloads images via HTTP or FTP.

member.name: T:Dynamsoft.DotNet.TWAIN.Delegate.OnMouseRightClickHandler

member.param: Specifies the index of image in buffer. The index is 0-based.
member.remarks: Short sImageIndex >=0. When the value of sImageIndex equals -1, it indicates that no image is right-clicked.
